nodes.text: A soul snare was a prismatic crystal which had the power to encapsulate the mind and Force essence of an individual for all eternity.
Soult snare's were a prismatic crystal which were used to imprison the mind and force essence of enemies of the Order of the Terrible Glare.

A gift from dark forces which dwelt in the realms of Illathurion, soul snares were crystalline devices given to the Order of the Terrible Glare in the wake of the Pius Dea Era. Wielded by the Shamans of the Terrible Glare, these crystals ripped the Force essence of the Jedi Vindicators who besieged Garn and sought to wipe out the Order's members. When the Jedi Grand Masters arrived to reinforce the Knights already on Garn, some soul snares were destroyed, but most remained lost in the ruins of the Terrible Glare's temples.
The Shi'ido Borborygamous Gog combined technology that he obtained from a Ssi-Ruuvi Swarm-class battle droid with soul snares to create the Essence Stealer.

A collection of soul snares were found by Luke Skywalker just before his encounter with Rur, which were said to be capable of holding a sentient being's life force for all eternity. Although Skywalker had earlier heard of these objects, he had never been aware of their existence until that point.

High Shaman Rur had used his computer-body to detect if lightsaber carrying people were near his location. In this way he desired to ensnare Jedi and imprison them, in vengeance for the Jedi Order's defeat of his splinter faction, the Order of the Terrible Glare.
These prismatic gem-like objects were first mentioned in the comic Blind Fury!. Their use was late extrapolated on in the unlicensed article, Cult Encounters of the Star Wars Universe.
